content: the golden vermillion necessaire is a charming mini colorwork project designed to make the most of scrap yarns born from the simple need for a compact organizer in my handbag to keep my comb mirror travel-sized moisturizer and lipstick neatly separated this little pouch combines functionality with beautiful traditional chinese colour aesthetics the size of the sample is 12cm width × 15cm length the pouch is constructed top-down in the round using three distinct sections 1 first a practical drawstring casing is created through stockinette knitting with strategically placed yarn-over eyelets which are then joined to the cast-on edge to form the drawstring channel 2 second the body features an elegant plaid colorwork pattern in golden yellow and vermillion red 3 the bottom is seamlessly closed using the kitchener stitch technique for a polished finish **1 materials and gauge** sample specifications * yarn novita nalle 80% wool 20% polyamide 260m/100g * colors yellow and red approximately 15g each * needles 2 5mm double-pointed knitting needles * gauge 25 stitches × 28 row =10cm × 10cm in colorwork yarn suggestions any sport to dk weight yarn approximately 260m/100g will achieve similar results however since this is a scrap-busting project for a simple pouch feel free to adjust your gauge and final dimensions based on whatever leftover yarns you have on hand **2 key techniques** * yarn over for creating drawstring eyelets * knit 2 stitches together for shaping and joining * kitchener stitch for seamlessly closing the bottom thank you for your support and happy knitting
